forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 80. South wind around 10 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Cloudy then Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers after 2am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 63. South wind 6 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon sun casts its golden glow over Boston, the sky stretches out in a gentle tapestry of blue, adorned with soft, fluffy clouds that dance languidly above. The air, warm and inviting—striking a balance around the 80-degree mark—beckons for leisurely strolls along the Charles River or perhaps an afternoon spent basking in one of the city’s many green parks. A light southern breeze whispers through the trees, infusing the day with a sense of calm as the world turns slowly to twilight.

As evening approaches, however, the atmosphere hints at the possibility of rain. While tonight may see the clouds thicken and hold the potential for scattered showers, the warmth lingers, with temperatures lowering only slightly. As raindrops tease the pavement after midnight, it’s wise to prepare for such a shift. Dressing in layers is advisable—light yet capable of withstanding the fleeting coolness that follows the day’s warmth. Whether one finds themselves sipping coffee at a cozy café or enjoying a quiet read in a well-lit nook, now is the time to embrace the fleeting charm of this late summer day, before the evening settles in with promises of a soft patter against the windows.
